text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss

- Swiss insurer Winterthur will sponsor an international conference on Jewish funds that were stolen by the Nazis during World War II. The conference will be organised by the Simon Wiesenthal Center and is scheduled to take place in Geneva between June 24 and 25.
- Swiss Transport Minister Moritz Leuenberger asked the the Swiss rail authority to conduct a study to determine how goods can be transported more economically.

- Young people in Switzerland tend to have sex later in life than then did 10 years ago, according to a recent study. The study of 16- to 20-year-olds also showed a stronger committment to relationships.
- Berne-based department store Loeb will sell and maintain the so-called Smart, a new car produced in joint-venture between Swiss watch maker SMH and and German group Daimler Benz.
